conclusion: Determine which container (E or F) the liquid will flow into after passing through baffles.
Liquid starts flowing from points A, B, C, and D as shown in Image 2.
Colors of the liquids at points A, B, C, and D are light green, pink, orange, and yellow respectively.
Liquids encounter horizontal baffles that redirect their paths.
Light green liquid flows down, encounters a baffle, and is redirected towards the right side of the board.
Light green liquid continues flowing downward, merges with other colors, and ends up in Container E.
Pink liquid flows down, encounters horizontal baffles, and is redirected towards the left side initially.
Pink liquid mixes with other liquids and its path leads it towards Container E.
Orange liquid flows down and interacts with the baffles.
Orange liquid is redirected, merges with other liquids, and its final path leads it into Container E.
Yellow liquid flows down and encounters the baffles.
Yellow liquid is redirected, mixes with other colors, and its path ultimately leads it into Container E.
All liquids from points A, B, C, and D will flow into Container E.
